meanings.definition: A member or adherent of the Methodist Church.
meanings.sent1: The methodist attended the church service every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: She became a methodist after attending the church for a year.
meanings.sent3: The methodist joked that they had a 'method' to their church potlucks.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the Methodist Church made him a true methodist in the community.
meanings.sent5: The methodist's commitment to helping others was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: A person who follows or advocates a particular method.
meanings.sent1: As a methodist, he always followed the same routine every morning.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was known as a methodist for his organized approach.
meanings.sent3: The methodist insisted on using a specific method for folding laundry.
meanings.sent4: She was a methodist in her approach to solving puzzles, always starting from the corners.
meanings.sent5: His reputation as a methodist in project management led to many successful outcomes.
